constraint.human: Can only have members if group is "actual"

element.definition: Represents a defined collection of entities that may be discussed or acted upon collectively but which are not expected to act collectively and are not formally or legally recognized; i.e. a collection of entities that isn't an Organization.

element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.

element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.

element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

element.requirements: Allows the group to be referenced from external specifications.
element.definition: A unique business identifier for this group.

mapping.map: person: ./classCode="PSN"  animal: ./classCode="ANM"  device: ./classCode="DEV"  medication: ./classCode="MMAT" and ./playedRole[isNormalRole() and classCode="THER"]  food: ./classCode="FOOD"

binding.description: Types of resources that are part of group

element.comments: Group members SHALL be of the appropriate resource type (Patient for person or animal; or Practitioner, Device, Medicaiton or Substance for the other types.).
element.short: person | animal | practitioner | device | medication | substance
element.requirements: Identifies what type of resources the group is made up of.
element.definition: Identifies the broad classification of the kind of resources the group includes.

element.requirements: There are use-cases for groups that define specific collections of individuals, and other groups that define "types" of intended individuals.  The requirements for both kinds of groups are similar, so we use a single resource, distinguished by this flag.
element.definition: If true, indicates that the resource refers to a specific group of real individuals.  If false, the group defines a set of intended individuals.

element.comments: This would generally be omitted for Person resources.

binding.description: Kind of particular resource; e.g. cow, syringe, lake, etc.

element.definition: Provides a specific type of resource the group includes; e.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.

element.requirements: Used to identify the group in human communication.
element.definition: A label assigned to the group for human identification and communication.

element.comments: Note that the quantity may be less than the number of members if some of the members are not active.
element.requirements: Group size is a common defining characteristic.
element.definition: A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group.

mapping.map: ./playedRole[isNormalRole()]/participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode="SBJ"]/act[isNormalAct and classCode="OBS" and moodCode="EVN"]

element.comments: All the identified characteristics must be true for an entity to a member of the group.
element.requirements: Needs to be a generic mechanism for identifying what individuals can be part of a group.
element.definition: Identifies the traits shared by members of the group.

binding.description: List of characteristics used to describe group members; e.g. gender, age, owner, location, etc.

element.requirements: Need a formal way of identifying the characteristic being described.
element.definition: A code that identifies the kind of trait being asserted.

binding.description: Value of descriptive member characteristic; e.g. red, male, pneumonia, Caucasian, etc.

element.comments: For Range, it means members of the group have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.
element.requirements: The value of the characteristic is what determines group membership.
element.definition: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group.

element.comments: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications cannot wrongly include excluded members as included or vice versa.
element.requirements: Sometimes group membership is determined by characteristics not possessed.
element.definition: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group.

element.short: Period over which characteristic is tested
element.definition: The period over which the characteristic is tested; e.g. the patient had an operation during the month of June.

element.short: Who or what is in group
element.requirements: Often the only thing of interest about a group is "who's in it".
element.definition: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.

A reference to the entity that is a member of the group. Must be consistent with Group.type.

element.meaningWhenMissing: The member is in the group at this time
element.short: Period member belonged to the group
element.requirements: Need to track who was in a group at a  particular time.
element.definition: The period that the member was in the group, if known.

element.short: If member is no longer in group
element.requirements: Sometimes you don't know when someone stopped being in a group, but not when.
element.definition: A flag to indicate that the member is no longer in the group, but previously may have been a member.
